abstract: The appointment generated a wave of optimism inside Ford, which is grappling with sharply lower sales and a loss last year of $12.6 billion.

lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., Oct. 11 — For decades, Detroit automakers watched many of the rising stars in their executive ranks flee to foreign-based rivals that promised brighter futures. Suddenly, that brain drain is being reversed, with three high-ranking officials from Toyota Motor of Japan deciding in recent months to leave for Detroit.

headline.main: Ford Hires Head of Lexus, Aiming for Toyota Magic
